intro: Litobrochia leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaf lithobryum, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its small, elongated leaves that are often curved and have a distinct midrib. This plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its ability to retain moisture in dry conditions makes it well adapted to harsh environments. Litobrochia leptophylla is found in various regions across the Mediterranean and parts of southern Europe.
